titleStmt.title: The invasions of Germanie with all the civill, and bloody warres therin, since the first beginning of them in anno 1618 and continued to this present yeare 1638 : wherein are described the severall battles, encounters, conflicts, and assaults, of cities, townes, and castles ... with a new and exact map of Germany ... : together with the progresse of every army, marked with severall markes or lines, with the pictures of the chiefe commanders on both sides / faithfully collected out of good and credible originalls by a Gentleman well deserving that hath suffered much in those warres.
titleStmt.author: Gentleman well deserving that hath suffered much in those warres.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I.Norton for I. Rothwell, and are to bee sold at the Sunne in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Bound with: The warnings of Germany (STC 3759), A true and brief relation of the bloudy battell (STC 1907), The lamentations of Germany (STC 24761) and Lacrymæ Germaniæ.
Reproductions of originals in the Newberry Library and Harvard University Library.
